description:
8.107 silencedetect
Detect silence in an audio stream.

This filter logs a message when it detects that the input audio volume is less
or equal to a noise tolerance value for a duration greater or equal to the
minimum detected noise duration.

The printed times and duration are expressed in seconds. The
lavfi.silence_start or lavfi.silence_start.X metadata key
is set on the first frame whose timestamp equals or exceeds the detection
duration and it contains the timestamp of the first frame of the silence.

The lavfi.silence_duration or lavfi.silence_duration.X
and lavfi.silence_end or lavfi.silence_end.X metadata
keys are set on the first frame after the silence. If mono is
enabled, and each channel is evaluated separately, the .X
suffixed keys are used, and X corresponds to the channel number.

The filter accepts the following options:

duration.description: Set silence duration until notification (default is 2 seconds). See the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax.

mono.description: Process each channel separately, instead of combined. By default is disabled.

noise.description: Set noise tolerance. Can be specified in dB (in case 'dB' is appended to the specified value) or amplitude ratio. Default is -60dB, or 0.001.

name: silencedetect

parameters.description: Set noise tolerance. Can be specified in dB (in case "dB" is appended to the specified value) or amplitude ratio. Default is -60dB, or 0.001.
parameters.name: noise, n

parameters.description: Set silence duration until notification (default is 2 seconds). See (ffmpeg-utils)the Time duration section in the ffmpeg-utils(1) manual for the accepted syntax.
parameters.name: duration, d
